title: The Walking Dead season 10 kicks off in outer space: Here's why
text:
The Walking Dead was out of this world last night – literally (Picture: AMC/Getty)

The Walking Dead explores completely uncharted territories during the season 10 premiere last night – it went to outer space.

Episode one, titled Lines We Cross, was welcomed with rave reviews from fans of the zombie epic, as The Walking Dead returned to fine form in the first full chapter without Rick Grimes (Andrew Lincoln).

And it went in big, kicking the new cycle off with a shot looking at planet Earth from above before USSR satellite blast across the screen. Little did viewers know, however, the satellite will go on to change the course of The Walking Dead as they know it.

Showrunner Angela Kang, who has been widely hailed as The Walking Dead’s saviour since taking the reins, explained all.

‘It actually, weirdly, started with conversations about ships and ghost ships, and like these ideas of things that are drifting around on the ocean,’ she explained. ‘We were trying to think of, “What are things that happen over time in an apocalypse that we haven’t explored on the show yet?” And so somebody brought up this idea of like, “Well satellites, like if they’re not maintained, they degrade and eventually fall out of orbit.”

The satellite will play a big part in Eugene’s arc this season of The Walking Dead (Picture: AMC)

‘It even happens in our world now, but it’s not as common because they’re being maintained.’

‘Thematically, we wanted to kind of talk about a war that felt like it had Cold War aspects and the Whisperers like always watching our people, and so a satellite felt like a good metaphor for that,’ Kang continued.

‘But we also just thought that that was a fun and, hopefully, a strange and exciting way to start the season and, you know, the satellite has other implications for the season going forward as well.’

Eugene Porter (Josh McDermitt) will have a particularly keen interest in the satellite and its contents…

The Walking Dead’s introduction to season 10 was suitably horrifying and is only going to get more disturbing as the Whisperers take centre stage with new recruit Gamma (Thora Birch) in episode two.
